abstract: Raytheon said fourth-quarter profit rose 26 percent on higher foreign sales and electronics work for a new Navy ship.
snippet: Raytheon said fourth-quarter profit rose 26 percent on higher foreign sales and electronics work for a new Navy ship.
lead_paragraph: Raytheon, the world’s largest manufacturer of missiles, said yesterday that its fourth-quarter profit rose 26 percent on higher foreign sales and electronics work for a new Navy ship. The company increased its sales and earnings forecasts for 2007.

headline.main: Raytheon Surpasses Sales and Profit Forecasts
